Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Description: This simple-shaped vessel has a large flat base and an elongated waist, and a flared slender lip. The lime clay of this vessel comes from Upper Egypt and the production of these vessels was popular throughout the Nile valley.
